custom_preconds: Give user is on Players CSP profile
custom_steps: When Clicking an edit button in View mode
custom_expected:

AND A Save button and a cancel button are available in Edit mode.
AND Clicking "Save" will conduct a required field and formatting check according to the data discovery.

title: As a user I want approving a contract with a CSP clause to have a CSP tab in the player profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN USER has created a MNC for player with CSP clause included
custom_steps: WHEN the MN Contract is approved with a CSP clause in it
custom_expected:
THEN a CSP record is created for the player.
AND player will have a CSP tab on their player profile with a status of "Current"
AND "Responsible Org" will be set to signing Org
AND Signing Date will reflect the signing date from MN Contract
AND the Living Allowance and Tuition Allowance "Commitments" will be populated using the information entered in the MN Conract's CSP clause
AND the 10 Year Expiration date will be set to 10 years from Signing Date 
AND Used amounts will all equal 0
AND Remaining Amounts will all equal Committed Amounts.

title: As a user I want to edit a Player's Payment History
custom_preconds: GIVEN user wants to edit a player's Payment History
custom_steps: WHEN editing a player's Payment History,
custom_expected:
THEN the Net Amount, Check #, and Payment MMailed fields should only be editable if the row is for an Invoice, and only if the Invoice's status = Paid (changing an invoice's status from Open to Paid should enable these fields.)
AND IF an Invoice is currently marked as Paid from the Invoice itself, the "Date" field on the Payment History should be set to the Date entered in "Check Date" field
AND IF it set from History, it should update the "Check Date" field on the associated Invoice.
AND IF an invoice status = Paid, the Date field should be editable, and also required
AND IF it is Open or Cancelled, it is not editable. (this date should not be editable for credits)
AND "Net" should not be editable for Credits.
AND "Net" should be required for Invoices with a status of Paid

title: As a user I want to see an error when I enter a Net Amount higher than the Total Amount

Error will display message #11

title: As a user I want to see an error when I attempt to enter an Invoice containing Expenses higher than the Maximum Allowed
custom_preconds: Given User is on Player's Invoice tab
custom_steps: When Clicking "Save" on an Invoice for a CSP with a Signing Date on or before 10/3/04
custom_expected:
* System will check to see if the total amount entered on the current invoice will cause the player to exceed the maximum amount for the selected term. 
* The system will need to check for other existing invoices and credits for the same term (Ex: 2014 Spring Semester), total those up, and then add the amount of this invoice to that total. (Ex: If there is a prior invoice for the same term for 4,000, a credit for 2,000 and this one is for 1,000 then 4,000 - 2,000 + 1,000 = $3,000. $3,000 will be the number used for the "total") 
* If this number exceeds the total "Per Semester" or "Per Quarter" (depending on if this invoice is for a Quarter or a Semester) Remaining Amount displayed in the player's CSP Summary, an error is displayed. Messages #26

title: As a user I want the Max Living Allowance to be calculated when I enter Credits on an Invoice (post 10/3/04)
custom_preconds: Given User is on players Invoice Tab
custom_steps: When editing a CSP Invoice, entering a value in the "Living Allowance Credits" box
custom_expected:
* System will automatically trigger the system to calculate the Maximum Living Allowance allowed for this invoice based on the number of credits entered and the term type selected (quarter or semester). 
* If a term type has not yet been selected, semesters will be assumed. Changing the term type field or altering the value in the credits field should trigger the recalculation of these values on the fly when the field loses focus.
* The Maximum Living Allowance will be calculated for semesters: 
    - (LA Credits Entered/12) * Per Semester Living Allowance Remaining = Maximum Amount or the Per Semester Living Allowance Remaining, whichever is greater
* The Maximum Living Allowance will be calculated for quarters: 
    - (LA Credits Entered/10) * Per Quarter Living Allowance Remaining = Maximum Amount or the Per Quarter Living Allowance Remaining, whichever is greater
* This maximum will display in the fields as indicated on the wireframe and data discovery.

title: As a user I want the Max Tuition Allowance to be calculated when I enter Credits on an Invoice (post 10/3/04)
custom_preconds: Given User is Players Invoice Tab
custom_steps: * When editing a CSP Invoice, entering a value in the "Tuition Allowance Credits" box
custom_expected:
* System will automatically trigger the system to calculate the Maximum Tuition Allowance allowed based on the number of credits entered and the term type selected (quarter or semester). 
* If a term type has not yet been selected, semesters will be assumed. Changing the term type field or altering the value in the credits field should trigger the recalculation of these values on the fly when the field loses focus.
* The Maximum Tuition Allowance will be calculated for semesters: 
    - (TA Credits Entered/12) * Per Semester Tuition Allowance Remaining = Maximum Amount or the Per Semester Tuition Allowance Remaining, whichever is greater
* The Maximum Tuition Allowance will be calculated for quarters:
    - (TA Credits Entered/10) * Per Quarter Tuition Allowance Remaining = Maximum Amount or the Per Quarter Tuition Allowance Remaining, whichever is greater
* These maximums will display in the fields as indicated on the wireframe and data discovery.

title: As a user I want the Max Amount to be calculated when I enter Credits on an Invoice (pre 10/3/04)
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players Invoice Tab
custom_steps: When editing a CSP Invoice, entering a value in the "Credits" box
custom_expected:
* System will automatically trigger the system to calculate the Maximum Amount allowed for this invoice based on the number of credits entered and the term type selected (quarter or semester). 
* If a term type has not yet been selected, semesters will be assumed. Changing the term type field or altering the value in the credits field should trigger the recalculation of these values on the fly when the field loses focus.
* The Maximum Amount will display in the Tuition Amount Maximum field and will be calculated for semesters: 
    - (Credits Entered/12) * Per Semester Remaining = Maximum Amount or the Per Semester Allowance Remaining, whichever is greater
* The Maximum Amount will be calculated for quarters: 
    - (Credits Entered/10) * Per Quarter Remaining = Maximum Amount or the Per Quarter Remaining, whichever is greater
* This maximum will display in the fields as indicated on the wireframe and data discovery.

title: As a user I want to edit an existing Invoice for a player with a CEP clause
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=cep
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=invoice_1

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+CEP+Invoice

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When viewing an Invoice in View mode, there will be an Edit button and a Close button in addition to the Print button. 
* Clicking "Close" will return the user to the point of entry. 
* Clicking "Edit" will reload the form in edit mode according to the wireframe and data discovery. The fields that are editable and required vary slightly based on the state of the Invoice.
* Club users will not be able to edit any of the fields under the "Payment Details" subsection if the Invoice's status has been previously saved as "Paid". The one exception is the Net Amount field, which should remain editable regardless of state. 
* BOC users will continue to be able to edit all of the fields, regardless of Invoice status.
* Club users are not able to change an Invoice's status from "Paid" back to "Open". 
* When viewing an Invoice in Edit mode, there is a "Save" button, as well as a "Save and Print" button, the Print button and a "Cancel" button. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes.  If they confirm, the form will reload in View mode and no changes will be saved. 
* Clicking "Save" will save any changes made to the CSP's invoice. 
* Saving will run a required field and formatting check according to the provided data discovery. The fields required will vary slightly depending on what "Status" is selected for the Invoice (not the CSP Status).
* A successful blue save notification will display.

title: As a user I want to be able to see a "Schools" tab on the CSP/CEP Dashboard
custom_steps: Wireframe:http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=csp_cep_schoolsData Discovery:https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=107118753Acceptance Criteria: * If a user has CSP view or edit permissions they see the "Schools" tab on the CSP/CEP Dashboard.* Clicking on the "Schools" tab will load the widget per the wireframe and the data discovery. * The browser tab text will say CSP/CEP Schools* The widget will be populated with all of the non-deleted CSP School profiles in the system. * The default sort will be on School Name. * Default column sort, filtering and exporting should work. * A submenu will be added to the main navigation with links in alphabetical order* Update the browser tab text to say CSP/CEP Players when the Players tab is active

title: As a user I want to be able to create a new CSP/CEP School Profile
custom_steps: Wireframe:http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=csp_cep_schoolsData Discovery:https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+CSP+SchoolAcceptance Criteria: * On the Schools widget there should be a "New School" Action Button for users with CSP edit permissions.* Clicking this should launch a new, blank school profile. * Form should match the provided wireframe and data discovery. * There should be a "Save" and  "Cancel" button in grey. * Clicking "Cancel" will ask the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes, and if the user confirms it will discard the profile entirely and return the user to the point of entry. * Clicking "Save" will run a required field and formatting check according to the data discovery. If that passes, the system will save the profile, display a blue success notification, and reload the form in view mode. * After the profile has been saved, it should be available for selection in Invoices and Player Letters.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to delete a CSP/CEP School Profile
custom_steps: Wireframe:http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=new_csp-cep_schoolData Discovery:https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+CSP+SchoolAcceptance Criteria: * When a BOC user with CSP edit permissions is viewing a school profile, they should see a "Delete" button. * Clicking this should ask the user to confirm that they wish to permanently delete the school profile. * If the user confirms, the system will delete the school's profile. * A blue successful notification will display. * Invoices that have been saved with this school's information prepopulated should not be impacted.

title: As a user I want the CSP lapse batch to update a player's Estimated Lapse Date
custom_preconds:
(Copied from Pivotal for reference):

Batch Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=91885937

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Running the batch will find all of the CSP's that are Current, Current - Living Allowance Only and Current - Tuition Allowance Only. 
* The system will estimate the potential lapse date for each CSP that falls in one of those statuses. 
* The batch will find the last date the player had a valid roster status OR the latest Paid Date or Check Date for the player, whichever is later, and add 2 years. 
* The Potential Lapse Date will display for each player in the Current CSP/CEP widget. Ultimately this information will also be part of the communication to the Player portal via mlb.com. 
* Valid roster statuses:
MJ: DFA, 15D, 15R, 10D, 10R, 7DC, 7CR, 60D, 60R, BRV, PTR, MIL, ACT, PND, SUS, OPT
Mn: ACT, 60D, 60R, 7DL, 7RH, TI
custom_steps:
WHEN the user finds a domestic amateur player
AND creates a new Minor Contract for them
AND adds a Continuing Education Program clause
AND approves the contract
AND runs the CSP/CEP lapse batch
custom_expected:
THEN this player gets a CEP lapse date and it is populated on the club's CSP/CEP widget
AND the CEP.mlb.com page for that player

title: As a user I want Max/Min and expandable filters to work together intuatively
custom_steps:
**AC**
*On Pending Approvals, Action Items and Advanced Search*

**Simple solution:**
- Clicking maximize will automatically collapse the filters
- Clicking minimize will simply minimize the widget, leaving the filters alone.

**More Difficult**
- If maximize is clicked and the filters are expanded check to see if the height of the widget will decrease.
      - If yes, it will decrease then collapse filters and maximize the widget
      - If no, it will not decrease then leave filters expanded and maximize the widget
- If minimize is clicked leave the filters as is and minimize the widget

**Original Problem:** Max/Min and expandable filters did not play well together.  On smaller screen sizes if man filters have been added to advanced search or on the clipboard hitting maximize will actually make the widget smaller and hitting minimize will make it larger.  This is because of how max/min determines how much screen real estate is available to use.

title: As a developer, we need an unauthorized rule check when one club attempts to edit another clubs professional player profile
custom_steps:
Professional player profiles should throw an error when the user is not allowed to edit the player in question.

There is currently no rule check in place when saving a player profile to ensure that the user is allowed to make the edit.  We only check that they have the correct roles and not whether the player can be modified.  The check should be expanded to include the following:

BOC users can update all players
Club users can update only players on their own team or free agent/released players who are not associated with another team.

title: As a user I want to see an error if too much tuition allowance money has been refunded to a player
custom_steps: Business Rules: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/CSP+CalcMessages:https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/CSP+-+MessagesAcceptance Criteria: * Part of the CSP Calc that is run on each Save of an Invoice and/or Credit should be to verify that a player has not had too much money refunded to them for a particular period. * This check will only apply for Invoices/Credits for CSPs with a Signing Date on or after 10/3/2004* If the dollar amounts entered on an Invoice or a Credit will cause the total tuition allowance amount for the Period the Invoice/Credit is being entered for to be greater than the available per period amount, then an error should be displayed.  See Messages #41

title: As a user I want to attempting delete a CSP Invoice to run the CSP calc first
custom_steps: Rules: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/CSP+CalcMessages:https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/CSP+-+MessagesAcceptance Criteria: * Clicking "Delete" on a CSP Invoice will run the CSP calc prior to allowing the user to continue with the delete. * The following are the particular rules that could be violated by a CSP Invoice delete:   * As a user I want to see an error if too much living allowance money has been refunded to a player. #144748403  * As a user I want to see an error if too much tuition allowance money has been refunded to a player. #144748405  * As a user I want to see an error if too much money has been refunded to a player. #144496959  * As a user I want to see an error if too many living credits have been refunded to a player. #144748905  * As a user I want to see an error if too many tuition credits have been refunded to a player. #144748907  * As a user I want to see an error if too many credits have been refunded to a player. #144496905

title: As a user I want to attempting to delete a CSP Credit to run the CSP calc first
custom_steps: Rules: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/CSP+CalcMessages:https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/CSP+-+MessagesAcceptance Criteria: * Clicking "Delete" on a CSP Credit will run the CSP calc prior to allowing the user to continue with the delete. * In particular the system will check that the deletion of the Credit will not cause the player to exceed the maximum dollar amount allowed for the CSP. If the deletion of the Credit will result in the player exceeding the maximum dollar amount allowed by the CSP for the relevant term, then the delete will not be allowed.* The following are the particular rules that could be violated by a CSP Credit delete:   * You have reached or surpassed the maximum dollar amount allowed for this pay period - Tuition Allowance. #142023125  * You have reached or surpassed the maximum dollar amount allowed for this pay period - Living Allowance. #142023121  * You have reached or surpassed the maximum dollar amount allowed for this pay period. #142023127

title: As a BOC user I want to see the CSP Players widget
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=csp_players_and_questionnaire

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a BOC user lands on the CSP/CEP dashboard, the "Current CSP/CEP" widget displays on a Players tab.
* There is an "Org" filter in the header. "All" should be an option, along with each of the 30 individual Orgs. By default this should be set to "ARI". 
* Org column should be available. 
* The widget should be populated with all of the players who have CSP with a status of Current, Current - Living Allowance Only or Current - Tuition Allowance Only. Completed and Lapsed players should not display. 
* The widget layout should match the provided data discovery. 
* Default sort should be on player's Last Name, secondary sort on player's First Name. 
* Player's Name should be a hyperlink to the player's profile - > CSP Tab. 
* Remaining, Used and Commitment columns will contain the relevant values from the player's CSP tabs. Players who have separate tuition and living allowances will display with "T - $0 / L -$0" per the wireframe. Players without the separation will display a single dollar amount in each column. 
* Estimated Lapsed Date logic/population will be delivered with another story. 
* 10 -Year Expiration should match that on the player's profile where applicable (not applicable to those who do not have a Living Allowance), this column should be blank for those players. 
* Questionnaire Sent column will be populated in a follow up story. 
* Default filter behavior and export should be delivered with this story.

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Club user lands on the CSP/CEP dashboard, the "Current CSP/CEP" widget displays. 
* There is no "Org" filter in the header. The widget should only be populated with players for whom the viewing Org is the Responsible Org and the user should not be able to view another Org's information.  
* Org column should not be available. 
* The widget should be populated with all of the players who have CSP with a status of Current, Current - Living Allowance Only or Current - Tuition Allowance Only. Completed and Lapsed players should not display. 
* The widget layout should match the provided data discovery. (aside from the exceptions noted already)
* Default sort should be on player's Last Name, secondary sort on player's First Name. 
* Player's Name should be a hyperlink to the player's profile - > CSP Tab. 
* Remaining, Used and Commitment columns will contain the relevant values from the player's CSP tabs. Players who have separate tuition and living allowances will display with "T - $0 / L -$0" per the wireframe. Players without the separation will display a single dollar amount in each column. 
* Estimated Lapsed Date logic/population will be delivered with another story. 
* 10 -Year Expiration should match that on the player's profile where applicable (not applicable to those who do not have a Living Allowance), this column should be blank for those players. 
* Questionnaire Sent column will be populated in a follow up story. 
* Default filter behavior and export should be delivered with this story.

title: As a user I want the Lapse batch to update a player's Estimated Lapse Date
custom_steps: Batch Rules: https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=91885937Acceptance Criteria: * Running the batch will find all of the CEP's that are Current, Current - Living Allowance Only and Current - Tuition Allowance Only. * The system will estimate the potential lapse date for each CEP that falls in one of those statuses. * The batch will find the last date the player had a valid roster status OR the latest Paid Date or Check Date for the player, whichever is later, and add 2 years. * The Potential Lapse Date will display for each player in the Current CSP/CEP widget. Ultimately this information will also be part of the communication to the Player portal via mlb.com. * Valid roster statuses:MJ: DFA, 15D, 15R, 10D, 10R, 7DC, 7CR, 60D, 60R, BRV, PTR, MIL, ACT, PND, SUS, OPTMn: ACT, 60D, 60R, 7DL, 7RH, TI

Acceptance Criteria:
* When creating a new Invoice for a player with a CEP clause, there should be a Save and a Cancel button. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel any changes made.

title: As a user I want to attempting to delete a CEP Credit to run the CEP calc first
custom_steps: Rules: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/CEP+CalcMessages:https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/CSP+-+MessagesAcceptance Criteria: * Clicking "Delete" on a CEP Credit will run the CEP calc prior to allowing the user to continue with the delete. * In particular the system will check that the deletion of the Credit will not cause the player to exceed the maximum dollar amount allowed for the CEP. If the deletion of the Credit will result in the player exceeding the maximum dollar amount allowed by the CEP, then the delete will not be allowed.* The following are the particular rules that could be violated by a CSP Credit delete:   * You have reached or surpassed the maximum dollar amount allowed for Tuition Allowance. #145003175  * You have reached or surpassed the maximum dollar amount allowed for Living Allowance. #145003171

title: As a user I want approving a Major/Minor Outright transaction for a player who is currently on Option to auto-recall them
custom_steps:
MJ/MN Outright Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89349694

Recall Business Rules: 


Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a MJ/MN Outright is approved for a player that is currently Optioned, the system should auto-create and approve a Recall transaction for the player prior to outrighting him. 
* The Recall should be created for the same transaction date for the Outright. 
* The Recall should have the "Recalled for Subsequent Assignment" checkbox checked. 
* The Recall should have the Report Date field empty. 
* The Recall should be processed as normal by the system, and inserted in the player's history prior to the MJ/MN Outright. 
* If for any reason the on submit/on approve rules for the Recall fail for the player, the MJ/MN Outright should also fail and not be approved. The error message for the recall should display for the user.

title: As a CEP Admin User, I want to require users to attach invoices to CSP Invoices
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is on a players CSP tab


Wire:  https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=invoice_1
custom_steps: WHEN CEP Admin user is viewing a CSP invoice
custom_expected:
THEN User will be see a new 'Attachments'  section added to *CSP* invoice, as depicted in the wire. 
AND 'Attachments' will be required to save
AND Label options for the attachments will be:
  -- Tuition/Fees
  -- Books/Supplies
  -- Living Expenses
  -- Other Covered Expenses
AND If 'Other Covered Expenses'is selected as the label, comments will be required for the file
  -- The bubble icon will become red if no comments have been added
  -- Once comments are added, the bubble will turn blue

title: As a CEP Auditor, I want the values renamed in the Other Configurations section of the CEP Tracking Utility
custom_preconds: GIVEN User is on the 'Configurations' section of the CEP Tracking tab
custom_steps: WHEN user views the field labels in 'Other Configurations' section of the CEP Tracking Utility
custom_expected:
THEN the field labels will match the updates in both order and description:
-	CEP to SB Minimum Level -> Minimum Level (High CEP to Signing Bonus)
-	Lower Threshold -> Minimum Signing Bonus (High CEP to Signing Bonus)
-	Upper Threshold -> Minimum Total Committed (High CEP to Signing Bonus)
-	Signing Bonus Pct Minimum -> Signing Bonus-CEP Percent (High CEP to Signing Bonus)
-	Level Rank 1 Threshold -> Level 1 Minimum Total Committed (High CEP to School Level)
-	Level Rank 2 Threshold -> Level 2 Minimum Total Committed (High CEP to School Level)
-	Level Rank 3 Threshold -> Level 3 Minimum Total Committed (High CEP to School Level)
-	Level Rank 4 Threshold -> Level 4 Minimum Total Committed (High CEP to School Level)
-	Level Rank 5 Threshold -> Level 5 Minimum Total Committed (High CEP to School Level)
-	Living to Tuition Minimum -> Minimum Living Used (Used 50% of Living; and Living Used > Tuition Used)
-	Add an adjustable leverage threshold for the Low Leverage Column. Titled Minimum Level (Low Leverage) preset at 3.

title: As a CEP Auditor, I want the Early Access to CEP column to use a rolling timeframe
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is on CEP Tracking tab
custom_steps: WHEN User enters values into all fields and click load/recalc button
custom_expected:
THEN the new calculation for 'Early Access to CEP' column will use a rolling timeframe
AND will be "if a player has used any amount of his CEP within 24 months of their signing date, the player is allocated .60 points

*previous calculation was hardcoded to players signed in 2019 - 2020*

title: As a CEP Auditor, I want to save changes to a Flag Weight template
custom_preconds: Wire: https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=save_a_flag_weight_templateAC: - When viewing a template, there will be a "save" hyperlink - Users will be able to save changes to all templates, including the default - Clicking the hyperlink will commit the changes  -- A blue Template Saved message will be displayed - Changes will only committed to the template currently being viewed

title: As a CEP Auditor, I want to delete a Flag Weight template
custom_preconds: Wire: https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=delete_a_flag_weight_templateAC: - When viewing a custom template, there will be a "delete" hyperlink - The "delete" hyperlink will not be active when viewing the default template - Clicking the hyperlink will launch a modal, as depicted in the wire - The modal will have Delete and Cancel buttons - Clicking delete will prompt the user to confirm their actions  -- If they confirm, the template will be deleted from the system, the modal will be dismissed, and the default template will be loaded  -- If they don't confirm, the modal will be dismissed - Clicking cancel will dismiss the modal

title: As a CEP Auditor, I want to create a new Flag Weight template
custom_preconds: Wire: https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=new_flag_weight_templateAC: - There will be a "new" hyperlink in the Flag Weight section as depicted in the wire - Clicking "new" will launch a modal containing all the field labels, but no values - The modal will also have a space for the user to enter a name for the new template - The modal will have Save and Cancel buttons - Clicking Save will commit the changes and dismiss the modal  -- A blue Template Saved message will be displayed - Clicking Cancel will prompt the user to confirm their action  -- If they confirm, the modal will be dismissed and nothing will be committed  -- If they don't confirm, they'll be returned to the modal

title: As a CEP Auditor, I want to export the CEP Analysis table
custom_preconds: Wire: [https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=analysis|https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=analysis]AC:* There will be an export button displayed at the bottom of the CEP Analysis section* The button will only be visible if there are players loaded into the table* Clicking Export will export the player population and correct values into an excel file for the user* The columns, order, and formatting will all match what is displayed on the UI

title: As a CEP Auditor, I want to load players on the CEP Analysis
custom_preconds: Wire:  https://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=analysisAC: - When loading the CEP Track dashboard, the CEP Analysis section will load without a population of players populated - There will be a "Load / Recalc" button displayed next to the filters - When the user clicks the button, the utility will load a player population based on the filters and values entered into the flag weight section - If the user does not adjust the filters before clicking the button, the utility will return a population based on the filter defaults - If there is already a population of players displayed and the user clicks the button, the utility will refresh the population of players based on the filters and recalc the values displayed based on the variables displayed in the flag weight section
